summary: The Immigration Enforcement Staff Body Camera Accountability Act mandates that all immigration enforcement staff wear body cameras during official operations. It establishes policies and procedures for body camera use, including training and the use of AI. Footage must be made available to parties in relevant proceedings. The bill requires rulemaking by the Secretary of Homeland Security, referencing existing guidelines. Staff face disciplinary actions for non-compliance and the Inspector General will conduct annual privacy impact assessments. Finally, the bill prohibits additional funding and defines immigration enforcement staff.
